page.title: 06BARTON HALL AND COTTAGES
page.content: To the east of Cagefield Road is a large building called{Barton Hall.} This is no longer used as a private dwelling.Its main use now is to store farm equipment.At the back of the Hall is{Barton Cottages.}The Hall and unoccupied cottages are said to be haunted.Caravans come in the summer months and park near the Hall for a few days at a time.The footpaths are numerous in this area and there are three decidious woods. { Bartonhall Creek}runs south-east into the{River Roach.}The land either side of the river in this area is uninhabited and relatively undisturbed and is therefore rich in the variety of seabirds it attracts along its marshy banks. Barges bring grain to the {Stambridge Flour Mill }once or twice a week.This grain comes from Canada.
